title: About
text:
Here is a short bio about myself…
I am from Riverside County, CA and grew up playing sports and watching sports such as baseball, basketball, and football. My number one interest is music and I am always listening to music or attempting to play music. I enjoy many genres such as rock, rap, metal, and pop. In my free time I like to stay active whether that be working out, climbing, running, or playing basketball. I also enjoy the outdoors and going for walks by the beach.

title: About
text:
Education
I graduated from Elsinore High School with a 4.1 GPA where I also played baseball and basketball. I am currently finishing up my third year at UCSB where I am studying for a double major in Economics and Sociology. I have future hopes to enroll in a graduate program, possibly in Environmental Studies.

title: Papers
text:
Going into my fourth year at UCSB I have reflected on the papers I have written throughout my time and I want to highlight some of my personal favorites here. They mostly cover sociological, historical, and political topics.

This paper was for a European History class and covers the history of European Imperialism and some decolonization movements such as the Algerian War.





For this next paper, I wrote about some African history and how there has been a sort of revisionist history and not only a physical colonization over the people of Africa, but also a colonization of the history.





Moving into my sociology papers, this one is on Karl Marx’s concept of the primitive accumulation of capital covered in volume of his series “Capital”.





These next two papers were on films, the first being the film Hunger which covers the experiences of IRA prisoners during the hunger strikes amidst the Troubles in Northern Ireland.





This last paper is on the movie Moonlight and covers topics of gender, race and class in a character analysis of the protagonist Chiron.

title: Music
text:
I mentioned in my bio how I am a big music fan and I wanted to highlight some of my favorite live concerts I have been to and share some photos.

—


Ethel Cain
Ethel Cain is one of my favorite artists who makes indie rock, alternative pop, and some gothic music. Her live performance was amazing and her voice creates an intriguing atmosphere.







The Cure
The Cure are my favorite band and I was introduced to them by my mom. I attended this concert with my mom and my sister, and it was probably my most enjoyable concert experience even though our view was far.







Kendrick Lamar
My favorite rapper is Kendrick Lamar who I had the honor of seeing live twice and this picture is from the second time at Outsidelands festival in San Francisco. His music is very powerful and he is a childhood favorite of mine. This performance was such a fun time.







Lana Del Rey
Lana Del Rey makes very melancholy and sad indie pop music usually dealing with romantic topics and seeing her live was a very ethereal experience. This was at the same festival where I saw the previously mentioned Kendrick Lamar and Ethel Cain performances.







Slowdive
The last and most recent concert was seeing the band Slowdive who are from the 1990s and make shoegaze and dream pop music. This was in Ventura, so it was the most local show and they put on an amazing performance.

title: Jayden Evans
text:
Introduction
Hi I’m Jayden Evans and this is my website!
